title: Senior Cloud Operations Engineer
content:
At NICE, we don’t limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Constantly. We’re relentless. We’re ambitious. And we make an impact. Our NICErs bring their A game and spend each day turning it into an A+. And if you’re like us, we can offer you the kind of challenge that will light a fire within you.
This position manages, deploys and maintains NICE's Corporate systems, SANs and supporting environment. This position manages, deploys and maintains all aspects of the Microsoft Windows Server and Linux environments, Mail, DNS, FTP, IIS, Active Directory, SharePoint, O365 and other server on-prem and cloud applications. They are also responsible for the management, deployment and maintenance of all hardware in these environments. You will also be responsible for managing, deploying and maintaining all hardware and software in the Corporate lab. One of the primary responsibilities is the evaluation, testing and deployment of new software and hardware. They are also responsible for properly configuring and deploying appropriate monitoring solutions to help maintain uptime. This individual will clearly outline the level of risk associated with a deployment and work to mitigate risk prior to a production release. They will be responsible for consolidation using different virtualization and cloud platforms and ensuring data is protected and recoverable. They will work with the IT Systems Administration team in varying capacities to ensure an excellent working environment for NICE employees team in varying capacities to ensure an excellent working environment for employeesA Typical Day Might Include the Following:

Manage and deploy Windows Domain and Active Directory environment.
Manage and deploy Exchange email servers, including anti-spam and gateway servers.
Maintain Operating System software – installing, upgrading, patching.
Set up and maintain server system and file security.
Cable and rack servers and supporting equipment in co-location facilities (some travel will be required).
Manage and deploy replication, imaging, and backups.
Manage Corporate Labs – software, hardware, power and network.
Monitor and optimize performance of servers.
Maintain documentation of servers and networking equipment.
Work with vendors to troubleshoot problems and RMA parts as needed.
Evaluate/recommend new products and services.
Take part in on-call rotation for after hour support.
Manage and deploy backup software and equipment.
Manage and deploy virtual environments. (VMWare and Microsoft)
Manage SharePoint environment.
Manage Debian, Redhat and Suse Linux installations.

To Land This Gig You'll Need:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Information Systems or related field or equivalent work experience required.
Required certifications: MCSA (Windows Server) and VCP
Preferred certifications: MCSE, VCAP-DCA
6+ years troubleshooting small to medium networks
6+ years working in a Windows server environment
6+ years working in a Windows 2012 R2, 2016, 2019 and 2022 server environment.
6+ years managing and deploying Windows domains, Active Directory, DHCP, IIS and DNS
6+ years managing and deploying virtual environments
6+ years managing and deploying Windows servers
6+ year installing/configuring server hardware and OS
6+ years managing and deploying monitoring solutions
3+ years of SAN deployment and administration
2+ year managing Windows server backups using third party tools (Veeam, Netbackup, etc.)
Experience successfully working under time constraints and deadlines
Experience working within a team of IT professionals; taking and following direction and completing tasks and assignments in a timely manner with a positive attitude

Basic Financial Responsibilities: 

Ensures access to systems is accurate and according to Job Descriptions.
Ensures equipment is accounted for, purchased and disposed of according to company policy.
Provide competitive quotes for software and hardware purchases.
Small computer parts purchasing

Bonus Experience:

SAN deployment and administration
O365, Azure, and AWS knowledge
SharePoint Adminstration
Setup/management of HPE servers and blades
Virtualization deployment and administration (VMWare or Microsoft)
Linux/Solaris administration
Apache/Tomcat and IIS administration and configuration
VoIP
Power Configuration

About NICE 
NICE Ltd. (NASDAQ: NICE) software products are used by 25,000+ global businesses, including 85 of the Fortune 100 corporations, to deliver extraordinary customer experiences, fight financial crime and ensure public safety. Every day, NICE software manages more than 120 million customer interactions and monitors 3+ billion financial transactions. 
Known as an innovation powerhouse that excels in AI, cloud and digital, NICE is consistently recognized as the market leader in its domains, with over 8,500 employees across 30+ countries. 
NICE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, neurotype, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.
